benchmark_config.jira_title: Implement/Test API: POST /1.0/kb/invoiceItems/{invoiceItemId}/tags - Add tags to invoice item

covered: Valid Payload: Multiple happy paths return 201 with a JSON array of Tag objects associated to the invoice item (TC01, TC02, TC03, TC04, TC05, TC22).
Required and optional headers: X-Killbill-CreatedBy enforced as required; X-Killbill-Reason and X-Killbill-Comment accepted (TC03, TC06).
Validation: UUID format for path param, invalid tag definition UUIDs, empty list, null/empty elements, extra unsupported fields, malformed JSON handled with 400 (TC07, TC09, TC10, TC11, TC12, TC24).
Not-found handling: 404 returned when invoice item does not exist or database has no items (TC08, TC15).
Duplicate handling: Duplicate tag IDs in request are de-duplicated; adding a tag that already exists on the invoice item does not create duplicates (TC13, TC20).
Large payloads and performance: Very large arrays and heavy-load performance tested (TC14, TC19).
Server error handling: Service unavailability and dependency failure return 503; timeout returns 504 (TC17, TC21, TC25).
State variations: Items with and without existing tags; maximum allowed tags constraint enforced (TC04, TC05, TC23).
gaps: Content negotiation and media types: No test asserting request Content-Type must be application/json and response Content-Type is application/json; no test for 415 Unsupported Media Type on wrong/missing Content-Type.
Response schema conformance: Tests do not validate the full Tag schema as defined in the contract (e.g., required fields, objectType=INVOICE_ITEM, audit fields).
Duplicate submission/idempotency across calls: No scenario repeating the exact same POST twice to confirm no additional tags are created and to verify expected status code on the second call.
Partial success semantics: No case with mixed valid and invalid tagDefinitionIds in one request to verify all-or-nothing behavior and expected error code.
500 Internal Server Error: No simulation of backend/database failure returning 500.

Body type validation edge cases: No tests for non-array body (e.g., object or string), arrays containing non-string types, or oversized/invalidly formatted UUID strings beyond a single generic invalid value.
Header validation boundaries: No tests for extreme lengths/Unicode in X-Killbill-Reason or X-Killbill-Comment, or trimming behavior.
Authorization granularity: 403 Forbidden not covered for authenticated users lacking permission (if applicable to this endpoint).
recommendations: Add tests to assert media types: verify response Content-Type=application/json on 201 and error responses; send requests with missing/incorrect Content-Type to expect 415.

Validate full response schema for Tag objects against #/definitions/Tag, including required fields and objectType=INVOICE_ITEM; verify tagDefinitionIds match and audit metadata is present when Reason/Comment are provided.
Add idempotency test: perform the same POST twice and assert the second call does not create duplicates; document/verify expected status code (201 vs 200/204) per API contract.
Introduce a mixed-validity request (some valid, some invalid tagDefinitionIds) to confirm transactional behavior (all-or-nothing) and expected error code.
Simulate a server-side failure (e.g., database exception) and assert a 500 response with an appropriate error body.
Expand body type validation: send a non-array JSON body, an array with non-string values (numbers/objects), and excessively long strings to ensure robust 400 responses.
Add boundary tests for headers: extremely long or Unicode values for X-Killbill-Reason and X-Killbill-Comment to confirm acceptance or proper validation.
If RBAC applies, add a 403 Forbidden scenario for authenticated users without permission to add tags.
